node.title: COVID-19 world latest: UK smashes case record again, Trump thanked for promoting vaccine
node.description: Here's the latest from around the world overnight.
node.content: ["Here's the latest from around the world overnight.\u00a0", "China", "Rising COVID-19 infections in China's city of Xian have spurred a lockdown of its 13 million residents, with stretches of highway eerily bare on Thursday, as many people queued in the cold to get their noses swabbed at testing sites.", "Australia", "Australia re-introduced curbs such as indoor mask-wearing, capacity limits and QR code check-ins to cover most of the population as daily infections hit a record.\u00a0", "UK", "Britain recorded a record number of new coronavirus cases on Thursday as the Omicron variant swept across the country, with the daily tally reaching 119,789 from 106,122 a day earlier.", "There were 147 deaths within 28 days of a positive case, up from 140 on Wednesday, the latest government data showed.", "France", "France had around 88,000 new confirmed COVID-19 cases on Thursday, health ministry data showed, the highest in the country since the pandemic began, and the number of deaths also climbed. France registered a further 179 COVID deaths in hospitals over the last 24 hours.", "Vatican", "All Vatican officials and employees will have to have a green pass showing they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or prove they have recovered from the virus, according to a decree issued on Thursday.", "Germany", "Germany's Robert Koch Institute for infectious disease confirmed the country's first death due to the Omicron variant of the coronavirus on Thursday.", "Italy", "The highly contagious Omicron coronavirus variant is spreading rapidly in Italy, the National Health Institute (ISS) said on Thursday. It went from 0.19 percent of cases on December 6 to 28 percent on December 20, a doubling time of just two days.\u00a0", "Italy reported 146 coronavirus-related deaths on Wednesday against 153 the day before, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 36,293 from 30,798.", "Italy is planning to tighten restrictions to try to curb a sharp rise in COVID-19 infections, including making mask wearing mandatory outdoors again, the prime minister's office said on Thursday.", "Russia", "Russia's coronavirus death toll passed the 600,000 mark on Thursday, Reuters calculations based on official data showed, after a surge of infections linked to the Delta variant.", "The Russian coronavirus task force reported 1002 deaths and 25,667 new infections in the past 24 hours.", "United States", "Canceled holiday parties, booster-shot recommendations and advisories to work from home are the new normal for Wall Street companies reacting to the fast-spreading Omicron COVID-19 variant ripping through New York and other financial centres.", "US President Joe Biden's steps to backstop hospitals and distribute coronavirus test kits, however welcome, are too little too late to stem a surge of Omicron-related cases over Christmas and New Year's, health experts said.\u00a0", "The White House is grateful that former U.S. President Donald Trump received and promoted getting the COVID-19 vaccine booster shot, Press Secretary Jen Psaki said on Thursday.\u00a0", "About a third of 360 white-tailed deer have tested positive for COVID-19 in Ohio, according to international researchers, raising fears it could mutate and come back to humans.", "Infections have started rising again across the six Gulf Arab states after months of low or falling figures, data from health ministries showed, as the Omicron variant spreads across the world.\u00a0", "Kenya", "Kenya's sudden decision to demand proof of vaccination to access public places and transport was met by a combination of bemusement, dismissal and the occasional spot of enforcement on Thursday as people headed home for Christmas.", "South Africa", "South Africa's health regulator on Thursday approved the use of Johnson & Johnson vaccine for a second dose or booster, paving the way for the shot widely used in South Africa to shore up protection against the Omicron variant.", "Data from South Africa which suggests the Omicron coronavirus variant is 70 percent to 80 percent less severe than Delta should not be extrapolated to all countries, the head of the Africa Centres for Disease Control (CDC) said on Thursday.", "He said that factors such as the young median age of the South African population could be playing a part in what was being observed in the country, and that differing vaccination rates between countries could also lead to different outcomes.", "Three doses of Sinovac's CoronaVac COVID-19 vaccine do not produce adequate levels of antibodies to fight the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, researchers from Hong Kong said in a statement.", "A three-dose course of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine is effective against the rapidly-spreading Omicron coronavirus variant, the pharmaceutical company said on Thursday, citing data from an Oxford University lab study.", "Reuters / Newshub.", "\u00a0"]
